name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Today was a big day for Donald Trump. He had a meeting with every member of his cabinet, and he even invited the president.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: I’m sorry, you ‘accidentally, very briefly cancelled’ what? I hate to be giving efficiency notes to the efficiency master, but perhaps next time we keep ebola prevention going the whole time.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Is Elon really asking for credit for only cancelling ebola prevention a little bit? It’s like he dropped a baby and went, ‘What? Look how fast I picked it up! Five second rule.'

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Oh, ‘green card privileges plus.’ See, I was still getting America with ads.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Did this guy just put a cover charge on America?

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: I mean, I guess it beats the old way of becoming a citizen, which was to marry Donald Trump, but still.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Quick question—when you say ‘we have measles outbreaks every year,’ are you talking about America or, like, you? ‘Cause right now it sounds like you might take out that whole room. And that would be… terrible, I want to say?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Everybody was there: RFK Jr, Pete Hegseth, Sean Duffy, Tulsi Gabbard, Kristi Noem. It was a who’s who of ‘why them?'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Well of course. I mean, we have all had that call with tech support. Hello? Your computer’s frozen? Have you tried turning it off? Uh huh. And then firing 4,000 people with an email?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That long, rambling response actually reminds me of circumcision, because someone really should have cut that dickhead off.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Reporters did reach out to Gleason but Gleason declined to comment. I am not surprised. It is really hard to speak clearly when you’re under a bus.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Echoing the eternal words on the Statue of Liberty, ‘Give your tired, your poor… psych! Gimme 5 million bucks, beeyotch! We buyin’ bottles in the clurrb.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘Green card privileges plus?’ So Trump’s gonna Delta Comfort our immigration system? ‘It’s great, there’s green card, green card plus, and green card world traveler, folks. You get lounge access, a hot towelette, all the little cheese cubes you can stack up.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Now those… are definitely numbers. Five, ten, fifty million trillion. I’m just putting this out there, what if we sold a hundred-zundred-gabba-gillion? Something to think about.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Well I’m sure that will only attract good people and zero criminals. [ Sopranos voice] ‘Yeah, I got a good guy to bring in. He can get rid of a body like that. I mean, he’s really good at playing the flute or computers or whatever the f*ck.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘Yeah, could be. Could be Russian oligarchs. Or some other nice folks I’ve met: Mister Skeletor, Gargamel, Nosferatu.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘Okay, welcome. I will now take questions on the United States’ grain exports to Malaysia. Yes, the gentleman from Fartcoin.biz. I’ll come to you next, Kanye.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: The correspondent added, ‘But I’m sure one we put the finishing touches on this monster we helped stitch together out of body parts and rage, he’ll be our friend again.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Buddy, you were all cooked the minute you didn’t stand up for the AP . At this point, the meat has fallen off the bone and he’s covering you with lemon slices all over your body. And obviously, some pumpable cheese.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Get your golden tickets from President Oompa J. Loompa.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: What a great idea. I’ve always said our immigration system should be run more like the customer rewards program at a casino in Atlantic City.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The land of the free—and by free, I mean five million bucks.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Let me tell you something, he may know oligarchs—but not as well as they know him .

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It’s all part of his plan to ensure groceries cost a million dollars a month.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: That’s right, we have ‘curfews on water.’ All water has to be in bed by ten o’clock, or it’s grounded.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I know that if you don’t live in Southern California, you assume there must be some little shred of truth to that story he just told. There’s not. There’s no limits on water, there’s no curfew on water, and the only thing he ‘wettened’ is the diaper he puts on every day.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The meeting was very productive. The first half was spent kissing Trump’s butt, the second half was spent kissing Elon’s.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: At one point, Elon acknowledged that his team had accidentally cancelled an ebola prevention program but the quickly fixed it. I don’t think that’s as reassuring as you think it is.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The Trump administration just announced that it is hand-picking the reporters who are allowed to cover Trump and ask him questions. Yup, Trump will now only take questions from Fox News, Foxier News, and Foxiest News.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: McDonald’s just announced one dollar Egg McMuffin day. It’s a little suspicious when an Egg McMuffin is cheaper than an actual egg.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Royal Caribbean is launching a Star Trek -themed cruise to celebrate the show’s 60th anniversary. We already have a Star Trek cruise, it’s called Virgin Voyages.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: America could never do this. Whenever a painting starts moving you, they’re like, ‘Close your eyes, your insurance doesn’t cover this.'

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Obviously, this prescription is for mental health only. You’re not going to break your leg and hear a doctor be like, ‘Quick, get this man extra strength Picasso!'

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Hey, it is fun to find out what Donald Trump would be doing if he wasn’t president.
